boardgame.name: Lairs, Dens and Burrows: Short adventures for Four Against Darkness, for Characters of Any Level
Tane, Rifugi e Nascondigli: Brevi avventure per personaggi di qualsiasi livello
boardgame.description:
Sometimes, you do not have the time to play a full dungeon, or maybe you just want something different between two long missions.
Lairs, Dens and Burrows is a collection of short encounters for the Four Against Darkness solo rules that are just perfect for that.
The nine super-short adventures presented here, for parties of any experience level, include:

On Our Way Home
The Lair of the Gray Orcs
Nest of the Manticore
An OId Man Gave Me This Map
The Nixie in the Wine-Skin
The Ivy-Covered Hole
The Hyena Pack
The Mayhem Machine
The Dark Unicorn.

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Kongo
boardgame.description:
Kongō (金剛, “Indestructible Diamond”), named for the mountain, was the first battleship of her class, serving in both the first and second world wars. At the time of construction in the early 1910s she was a capital ship (the last Japanese Capital ship to be built outside of Japan) and was among the most heavily armed ships in any Navy. She received two major reconstructions throughout her life, the first being in 1929, she was rebuilt as a battleship, then later in 1935, along with her sister vessels, her superstructure was completely rebuilt, resulting in an increased rate of knots that would allow her to keep pace with the developing carrier groups – thus reclassifying her a s a fast-battleship.

Kongō’s World War II service history includes covering the Japanese amphibious landings in British Malaya and the Dutch East Indies in 1942, shortly before engaging American forces and Midway and during the Guadalcanal campaign. 1943 saw her almost entirely stationed in the Caroline Islands, only being deployed in response to aircraft carrier raids against Japanese Islands scattered across the Pacific. She was part of the Battles of the Philippine Sea and Leyte Gulf in 1944, successfully sinking enemy vessels in the latter. Her ultimate fate was at the hands of a US Submarine (USS Sealion) whilst crossing the Formosa Strait on 21 November 1944. She has the unfortunate distinction of being the sole Japanese battleship sunk by submarine in WW2.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Zuikaku
boardgame.description:
Zuikaku ( 瑞鶴 “Auspicious Crane”), a Shōkaku-class aircraft carrier, along with her sister ship, were the most successful carriers operated by the Japanese Navy during WW2. The Japanese had learnt many lessons prior to her construction and as such Zuikaku was considerably larger, better armed, and had a higher aircraft capacity than previous purpose-built Japanese Carriers. Setting sail in November 1941, her complement of aircraft included 18 Mitsubushi A6M fighters, 27 Aichi D3A dive bombers and 27 Nakajima B5n torpedo bombers.

She was part of the task force whose aircraft attacked Pearl Harbor in December 1941, and was a prominent participant in many subsequent battles in the Pacific Ocean – including, Java, Ceylon, the Coral Sea, the Eastern Solomons, Santa Cruz, the Philippine Seas and Leyte Gulf. It was at this last action that she was sunk, at the Battle of Cape Engano on 25 October 1944. She was the last of the six carriers that participated in the Pearl Harbor attack to be sunk.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Suzuya
boardgame.description:
The heavy cruiser, Suzuya, is believed to be one of the deepest shipwrecks on record at (a yet) unconfirmed 27,600 feet. She met her fate at the Battle of Leyte Gulf when she was beset upon by carrier-based aircraft – a torpedo exploding in her own tubes set off a chain reaction of fired and damage that forced the ship’s abandonment.

Prior to her sinking, she was involved in covering the landings at Malaya, the invasion of Sarawak, raids in the Indian Ocean, The Midway invasion force, the Solomon Islands, and the Battle of the Philippine Sea.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Mikuma
boardgame.description:
The second of the four Mogami class heavy cruisers, Mikuma was completed in 1935 but quickly underwent refits to replace her main turrets with twin 203 mm guns. Her former weapons, triple 155mm guns went to Yamato. Early in her career she was tasked with the occupation of Cochinchina, the invasion of Malaya and the invasion of British Borneo.

At the Battle of Sundra Strait Mikuma engaged the Allied cruisers USS Houston and HMS Perth, both of which were sunk. Mikuma then participated in the Indian Ocean Raids, before being recalled for the Midway operation. It was here she met her demise; on 5 June 1944, she was badly damaged by a friendly ship collision attempting to evade US submarine torpedo attacks. A succession of attempted airborne attacks, from B-17s to Vought SB2U Vindicators all failed. The next morning, however, SBD Dauntless dive bombers from USS Enterprise and Hornet managed to successfully inflict 5 bomb hits resulting in a cataclysmic chain reaction of explosions of the onboard AA shells and torpedoes.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Yahagi
boardgame.description:
'Yahagi was the third of the Agano class of light cruiser, intended to be the flagship of a destroyer flotilla. She was completed in December 1943. She participated in the Battles of the Philippine and Leyte Gulf and remained relatively unscathed despite weathering repeated attacks by enemy aircraft during these actions.

She was one of the vessels instructed to accompany Yamato on its final suicide run against the American invaders off Okinawa. On 7 April 1945, this task force was beset by 386 enemy aircraft. During the first wave of these attacks, Yahagi was struck directly in the engine room, and rendered unmovable. Subsequent waves rained more bombs and torpedoes upon her, such damage making rescue impossible.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Kagero-class Destroyers
boardgame.description:
Essentially an enlarged Fubuki-class, the Kagerō-class hull design was scaled up to overcome earlier design deficiencies. As a result, the Kagerō-class was the equal of any of its contemporaries in other navies and superior to most. Only the initial lack of radar and continued poor quality of sonar equipment and anti-aircraft defences (shortcomings which bedevilled all Japanese destroyers) hindered their performance.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: My Immortal Loneliness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After a strange necrotic energy washes over the village of Greenspar, characters must investigate the source of this (un)deadly affliction. Will they be able to exterminate the source of this blight, or fall prey to it themselves?

A Two to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: USS New Mexico
boardgame.description:
USS New Mexico (BB-40) was the lead of her class of battleship and served with the United States Navy between 1918 and 1946. She was the first ship with a turbo-electric transmission, capable of a cruising speed of 10 knots. She served as an escort to President Woodrow Wilson’s voyage to Brest, France, for the signing of the Treaty of Versailles. She operated repeated exercises in Pacific and Atlantic waters in the interwar period and received major modernisation between 1931 and 1933.

Initially, in World War II, the vessel was involved in neutrality operations in the Atlantic. This soon changed after the attack on Pearl Harbor. She returned to the Atlantic and participated in shore bombardments including at Attu and Kiska, Tarawa, the Marshall Islands, the Mariana and Palau Islands Leyte, Luzon and Okinawa. She also performed escort duties, patrols and received refits during this period. USS New Mexico was subject to repeated kamikaze attacks during her WW2 service, which inflicted heavy damage and loss of life. However, she persevered and was present in Tokyo Bay for the Japanese surrender that officially ended the war.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: USS Essex
boardgame.description:
Built during World War Two, USS Essex was the lead of her class of aircraft carriers. She was commissioned in December 1942 and went on to serve in several campaigns in the Pacific Theatre of operations. For her efforts, she received the Presidential Unit Citation and 13 battle stars. She operated right until the finale of the war, participating in the final raids against the Japanese home islands between 10 July to 15 August 1945.

Though already moderately armed, the primary offensive capability of a carrier was, of course, its aircraft, known as “Sunday Punch”. This comprised up to 36 fighters, 36 dive bombers and 18 torpedo bombers. Typically, the standard fighter would be the Grumman F6F Hellcat, the dive-bomber/scout the Curtiss SB2C Helldiver and the torpedo bomber the Grumman TBF Avenger as the torpedo bomber.

At the close of the war, Essex was decommissioned but modernized and recommissioned in the 1950s, serving as an anti-Submarine carrier. During this time, she participated in the Korean War and was key in the Cuban Missile Crisis. She also has the distinction of being the primary recovery carrier for the Apollo 7 space mission.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Tanzimat: Reform & Crisis in the Ottoman Empire
boardgame.description:
This historical semi-cooperative Eurogame is set in the Ottoman Empire between 1839 and 1876, at the time of the Tanzimat reforms. The Tanzimat reforms were an ambitious attempt on the part of liberally minded Ottoman sultans and politicians to modernize the aging empire and thereby keep it from disintegrating.

Players in the game represent Ottoman court factions who enlist Statesmen to use their bonuses, enact Reforms and reduce the number of Troubles in the empire. They must keep an eye on three common resources: Finances, Army and Standing. Event cards are drawn at the start of each turn that add new Troubles to the map, possibly causing Revolts.

The game consists of two Ages. At the end of each Age, a Crisis happens. (The Crisis may happen earlier if the number of Troubles and Revolts reach a critical number.) Only one player can win, but all players can lose if they let the empire crumble.

—description from the designer
The game is fully PnP!

COMPONENT LIST
1 rulebook
1 game board
40 Statesmen cards
30 Event cards
30 Reform cards
24 Sultan’s Decree cards
16 Legacy cards
9x4 buildings (Schools, Factories, Juries)
24 markers (partitions, Finances, Army, Standing, income, Loans, Revolts, game effects)
40 cubes (Troubles) - not included in the game!
5x4 cylinders (Influence, player order, VP, offices, Reform stage) - not included in the game!

boardgame.name: Great Minds
boardgame.description:
Great Minds is an easy party game where players must solve the puzzle to escape the mind maze.

The mind maze grid board is laid out with 25 clue cards. Each of the clue cards is a different word. Players then take a set of mind cards numbered 1 to 5 and a 2 matching coloured mind tokens, these tokens represent them in the game. The mind maze board also contains a score tracker, and one of the player tokens is added to this tracker.

At the beginning of the game, there will be 25 cards on the mind maze board with different words. Each card has a grid reference letter and number attached to it. The center card of the mind maze grid (C3) is removed and becomes the first clue.

Starting with the top row, player secretly select and play, face down, a numbered mind card relating to a word on the grip and the initial clue. Once all players have played a card, the card are all turned over and players place their mind token on their chosen word. Players get a point if they have successfully picked the same word as another player. The word(or words) with the most votes, becomes the clue for the next row. Once a row is complete, the words on that row are flipped over to reveal new words. Play continues down the mind grid, once player reach the bottom, they go back to the top of the grid, but now the words are different and there are less of them.

When all words have been eliminated from the mind maze, the player with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Twarzą w twarz
boardgame.description: Twarzą w twarz to zbiór 10 scenariuszy przeznaczonych do gry w formacie 1v1 - jedna Strażniczka i jeden Badacz.

boardgame.name: Campo de Mitos
boardgame.description:
Campo de Mitos is a land full of myths and legends, history and dark secrets that lurk in places you wouldn’t imagine.
Campo de Mitos is a campaign setting for cosmic horror roleplaying games. This campaign setting contains dozens of locations and even more NPCs with adventure seeds to use in your Cthulhu games, but this book has a twist: it’s based on real locations and historic events.
Europe is full of legends, stories and history full of mysteries which people do not even realise exist. Monuments of unknown origins, traditions with perverse rituals, dynasties with murky and bloody pasts - we explore some of them in this book.

boardgame.name: Onetop Football
boardgame.description:
ONETOP FOOTBALL is a football card game that anyone can easily enjoy with real football rules.

How to play
① They are divided into home team and away team.
② Out of 10 tactical cards, choose 5 cards to use as your tactics, mix them well with 23 player cards, and place them as shown in the picture. (Set aside tactical cards that are not used.)
③ Each player draws 5 cards from the top of the deck and holds them invisible to the other party.

Game progress
① Each player turns one player card over and places them in the midfield area.
② In the midfield area, the number of passes of player cards is compared.
③ The winning player compares the player cards in the opponent's penalty area when comparing the next player cards.
④ In the penalty area, place 1 player card face down invisibly.
⑤ Compare the attack number of the attacking player card with the defending number of the defending player.
⑥ If you win by comparing player cards in the opponent's penalty area, you will score 1 point.
⑦ If you lose in the penalty area, return to the midfield area and compare the player cards.
⑧ If the number of player cards to be compared is the same, compare again with other player cards on the spot.
⑨ The used cards are stacked in the used card deck, and the number of cards used in the new card deck is taken from the top, and the play continues while maintaining 5 cards.
⑩ Place the scored player card in front of you to make it easier to calculate the score after the game.
⑪ Only one tactical card can be used.
(Tactical cards that are used with player cards are turned over so that the opponent cannot see them and placed next to the compared player cards.)
⑫ If one of the players has no more player cards to compare, the match ends. The player with the highest total score is the winner.
⑬ If the score is the same, each player selects 5 player cards randomly and compares the attack numbers one by one. The player with the highest number of cards won is the final winner.

boardgame.name: Battlefield 3: Limited Edition
boardgame.description: Compilation of Battlefield 3 & "Back to Karkand" DLC
boardgame.videogamedeveloper: EA Digital Illusions CE AB (EA DICE)

boardgame.name: Black Paradox
boardgame.description:
Black Paradox is a fast-paced roguelite shoot 'em up. Unleash an arsenal of weapons, power-ups, drones, and other upgrades to survive waves of enemies, against a backdrop of vibrant pixel art and synth-wave soundtrack. As the infamous bounty hunter Black Paradox, travel through space and defeat the most dangerous criminal organization in the galaxy: the Hellraisers and its seven lieutenants.Enter the cockpit, ready your weapons, and prepare for the ultimate galactic showdown.

Key feature

20 weapons, 37 powerups, 13 drones, 8 power-up combos
62 different enemies, each with its own attack patterns
14 deadly bosses with unique attacks + 1 secret boss
Upgrade your stats and unlock new powers
2 player local co-op
Amazing pixel art, awesome synth-wave soundtrack
Extra hardcore boss rush mode to unlock


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Das perfekte Wort
boardgame.description:
Das perfekte Wort (German for The perfect Word) is a competitive word game for one to six players.

The game is played over 9 rounds. At the start of the game, a score card is drawn that determines how many points the different vowels in a word are worth during this game.

Each round, the players reveal a combination of a letter and a word length. They then have one minute to come up with a word that scores them as many points as possible.

The word has to start with the given letter and may not be longer than the given length. Points are awarded for finding a word at all, for matching the maximum length, for vowels, for rare bonus letters, and for each letter that matches one of the pre-printed letters on the game sheet.

The player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:
Banshee (from Village Attacks, in collaboration with Grimlord Games) adds a reimagined Banshee, a Wind Witch to the game!

This mini-expansion to Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum comes with a Banshee Witch miniature, Witch ID card, Grimoire, 3 Witchcraft Spells, and bonus Creature ID Cards and Summoning cards for Leshy, Wendigo and the Succubus from Village Attacks.

US Shipping $5

boardgame.name: Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum – Horvath and Dagon
boardgame.description:
Horvath and Dagon (from Black Rose Wars, in collaboration with Ludus Magnus Studio) adds a male Witch to the game! Bound to his familiar Dagon, Horvath drains the Creature's health to keep himself alive.

This mini-expansion to Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum comes with a Horvath and Dagon miniature, Horvath and Dagon Witch ID card, Grimoire, 3 Witchcraft Spells, and a bonus separate Dagon Creature ID card and Summoning card.

boardgame.name: LISTicles
boardgame.description: A category card and a bonus letter are revealed each round. Players have 90 seconds to write out seven entries that fulfill the category. Only unique answers will score and entries that begin with the bonus letter earn extra points. Play continues until 4 rounds are played. Each player adds up their scores for all four rounds and the player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.description: This full set of custom engraved marble dice will be a beautiful Add-On to your game.

boardgame.name: Hamsterdam
boardgame.description:
The once peaceful town of Hamsterdam is in danger! The vile chinchilla Marlo and his Vermin Gang are wreaking havoc and terrorizing the town. Enter our hamster hero, Pimm, who must harness his mightiest martial arts powers and kick tail through district after district, on a heart-pounding journey to take down the Vermin Gang, save his grandpa, and restore peace to Hamsterdam.

Hamsterdam is a game where classic brawler mechanics meet rhythm and precision. You’ll need a blend of martial arts combos, quick reactions, and timely counters to survive vermin confrontations and boss battles. Swing, swipe and strike your way through the mean streets of Hamsterdam with gesture controls for Switch, touch for iOS or full controller support for a classic experience on PC. Whichever platform you choose, you can experience frantic action, flawlessly execute rhythm combos, and become one with the Hamster-Fu.

Background:
Lurking just beneath the facade of tranquility in Hamsterdam, vermin skitter in the sewers and stalk the alleys bathed in red light, carrying out the sinister plans of the vile chinchilla Marlo. When the spreading vermin turf war and the distribution of the libation Marlo Tonic reached a once peaceful neighborhood, Pimm and Grandpa, the old Hamster-fu master, stood up for the innocent. In a selfless sacrifice to stop the pestilence, Grandpa yielded to Marlo’s cronies, passing the mantle of resistance to Pimm. Pimm now holds the fate of Hamsterdam in his paws.

Features

Swing, beat, swipe, and tap your way to epic vermin beat downs
Unique brew of classic frenetic brawler, rhythm, and quick reactions
Master the ancient hamster martial art form; Hamster-Fu
Heart & fist-pounding boss showdowns. The skies rain bombs! Try dodging 1,483 of them
A chinchilla mob boss plus a gang of trash can wearing, tonic chugging vermin
Rescue Hamsterdammers and Grandpa, and lead the resistance to save Hamsterdam
From Couture to Streetwear - offering the finest hamster apparel for on-point beatdowns.
Ride in style on the Ham-mobile: a two wheeled, chrome plated, pipe-grinding scooter


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Operation Market Garden
boardgame.description:
World War 2 in your pocket Operation Market Garden is a two player card game, ideal as a filler before or after your main gaming event. Also great as a travel game to take on holiday or when you're out with friends. It plays in 20-40 minutes for players aged 8+. It's quick to learn but strategic, learn from your enemy and try to get inside their mind to work out what sequence they will lay their cards down. Artwork by Adrian Stone.

Recreating the largest airborne invasion in history, Operation Market Garden in World War 2. Use your battle and tactic cards to out smart your opponent, use your equipment wisely, reveal events and monitor your divisions. Can you win enough battles to secure the vital bridges, will you be able to capture and hold all of them in time?

Each round consists of 7 battles, to win a battle the player must have the highest points score. The player will combine, battle, tactic, equipment and event cards to get to their total score. Whoever wins the most battles wins the bridge. The Allied player must win the bridge to proceed to the next bridge a draw is not enough. Players will take it in turns to be the Allied player to see how many bridges they can capture. The German player can reduce the effectiveness of the Allied player by altering the Allied Division cards, the Allied player can try and counter this using the Victoria Cross card but these are limited so you must use them wisely.

Events can be positive or negative for both sides. Players must try and work out what sequence their opponent will lay down their cards. They must remember what cards have already been used and try and get inside their opponents mind to out think them, what did they do last round, will they do the same thing, which combinations of cards do they favour, when should I use my Victoria Cross card. There are only 3 equipment and 3 tactic cards for each side so they must be used carefully. Can you get your opponent to use their most powerful card on your weakest card?

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Ninjin: Clash of Carrots
boardgame.description:
BE A NINJA. Play as either Ninjin, the charismatic rabbit, or Akai, the ninja fox, and fight across a feudal Japan to defeat the evil Shogun Moe and retrieve the carrots he’s stolen!
FAST AND FURIOUS COMBAT. Dodge rockets, blast through throngs of incoming enemies and battle bosses in frenzied, fast-paced action.
SLASH, SMASH AND BASH WITH FRIENDS! Join your friends in 2-player local or online co-op as you progress through the game’s story.
ENGAGING STORYLINE. Follow a robust Story Mode, meet a diverse cast of characters, and play through multiple stages in a crazy universe.
DEEP CUSTOMISATION. Choose from a huge variety of equipment with more than 150 weapons and items, including masks, swords, projectiles, and more.
ONI TV SHOW. Compete in a “Live TV Show” survival mode, solo or with a friend, to see who can get the furthest without dying, as wave after wave of enemies attack from all angles.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Liege 1914
boardgame.description:
The Battle of Liege was the opening engagement of the First World War and the first step of the German Schlieffen Plan. Liege, a city protected by a ring of twelve forts, blocked the passage of the German First and Second Armies. It contained the railway bridges crossing the Meuse river that would be needed by the advancing armies. Winning a quick victory over the Belgians was critical to the success of the German plan so a surprise attack of six brigades was launched ahead of the heavy artillery that ultimately destroyed the forts.

Liege 1914 is a regimental-level simulation of this opening battle of the Great War. Players assume the roles of the commanders of the German and Belgian troops as they desperately fight for this valuable position in the line.

The 17 x 22" map shows the western portion of Belgium from the German border to Liege. The 240 1/2" counters (die-cut and back-printed) show German and Belgian forces involved in the battle.

Liege 1914 is now the second installment in the Great War Battles series. Based on the Ypres 1914 game system (the first in the series), the Great War Battles is a series of games devoted to simulating battles of the First World War. Battles are covered at the brigade/regiment level using a common set of rules. Games in the series will cover a variety of situations ranging from trench warfare to open fighting.

boardgame.name: Slash It Ultimate

User Summary

boardgame.name: Super Inefficient Golf
boardgame.description:
GOLF FOR INEFFICIENT BADASSES! Why hit a ball with a metal stick, when you can stick MINES to your ball?

Super Inefficient Golf improves upon the most inefficient game ever conceived, by making it even LESS efficient. Master the art of carefully placing your mines, detonating them with expert timing, and BOOM - Birdie!

The game is divided into two phases: setup your golf ball with mines, then blast it into space (or better, into the hole) by detonating them! You have full control on which mines explode and when, which gives you complete power over your rocket ball trajectory. Golf clubs will feel so basic after this!

Features


18 challenging holes - increasing difficulty, no tutorial. Are you tough enough?
Slowmo and acrobatic aerial turns - total control, albeit very inefficient!
Unbelievable views - enter a chill, relaxed environment in which your swearing will echo for miles around.
Online Leaderboards - Join the global challenge.
Explosions! - Exploding mines, exploding barrels, exploding explosions all around!
Game up! - Bernard Suits would be super happy of our lusory attitude.


Source: The Game Press Kit.

boardgame.name: Het Deventer Spel
boardgame.description: You will make an exciting and informative stroll, by rolling dice to move, through Deventer where you ultimately have to collect three eagles. By answering questions, collecting properties and some luck you can earn enough money to buy the three eagles. Which player will win the game after several strolls through Deventer and deliver the three eagles at the missionary of the Lebuïnus Church?

boardgame.name: The Law - Dispatch Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a session of The Law, there are two types of participants. Most Portray “agents”, bringing justice to lawless sectors and investigating major crimes; one portrays the role of “dispatch”, who provides scenes for the agents to interact with and facilitates the play experience.
...
The whole game is designed in comic book format, illustration heavy, and filled with icons and accessible terms to make it aproachable for new roleplayers and those who are veterans of other systems.

This is the second book in the line. It has been designed to provide GMs with additional tools to help them work through investigations with their team of agents, and deal with the crimes that fester in all corners of the urban sprawl.

boardgame.name: Eberron Confidential
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Everyone's hiding something! What's a secret you've never shared? Are you hiding an aberrant dragonmark? Were you kicked out of Arcanix? Were you actually raised by gnolls? Or are you [REDACTED]?

In Eberron Confidential, setting creator Keith Baker presents a host of secrets for DMs and players to enjoy. Each secret provides a unique connection to the world of Eberron, an intriguing story hook for the DM to explore, a minor mechanical benefit, and unlimited roleplay potential.

boardgame.name: Living Spells
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this work, spells are presented that will not only last until dispelled but are predators as well if uncontrolled. Created by powerful magicians those spells scourge the lands and could be used as plot-hooks as well. Maybe you've heard stories about mystical happenings in the woods or mountains or even an undead carriage offering rides to villagers.

Living Spells contains 22 new spells and descriptions of their 8 creators.

User summary:

This item originally was released as part of the Pen Paper Dice 2020 Release Bundle.

boardgame.name: The Fateseeker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While studying stars, constellations, the sun and moon as well as the rare knowledge about fate itself, the mastery of the deck of sixty is their most specific practice. Fate-Seekers use the deck of sixty for fortune telling by interpreting the minor and major arcanas they are able to draw upon. Their mentor grants them their deck and teaches them how to draw cards. Drawing is an act of magic and therefore not something mere men might accomplish. After studying the art of channeling magical energy through the cards, the next step is to predict future and fate from the cards drawn.

User summary:

This item originally was released as part of the Pen Paper Dice 2020 Release Bundle.

boardgame.name: Summoner
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The air crackles with power as her focus establishes an arc-like connection with her shimmering, bipedal conduit.

Waves of pure magical energy wash over the land, emboldened by her companion.

A sly smile on his face, the dishevelled-looking human whispers a powerful word into the seemingless innocuous stone within his hand. In the next moment he is atop a large fiery bird leaving the bandits of the forest behind.

A scholar hastily gathers scrolls and tomes in a sack and flings it over her shoulder. Panicked, her gaze wanders to the front door of her study. Loud yells and sounds of wood crashing into wood come from the other side. Her large companion is blocking the attempts to crush the portal with his body's mass.

Summoners are rare individuals that have, intentionally or by chance, discovered secrets to long forgotten contracts with otherworldy beings. Through these contract, extradimensional beings find their way onto the material plane and form alliances with the Summoners.

These relationships can take many forms, from friendship to servitude. However, they are always mutually beneficial.

User summary:

This item originally was released as part of the Pen Paper Dice 2020 Release Bundle.

boardgame.name: Devil Fruits
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"You want my throne? Then come and get it! These words of Asmo D. Eus marked the start of a new era of adventurers."

This work contains some snippets of lore regarding the existence of devil fruits in the Forgotten Realms, rules for five powerful, cursed fruits and stat-blocks for corresponding devils that grant some of their power to whoever eats the fruit.

User summary:

This item originally was released as part of the Pen Paper Dice 2020 Release Bundle.

boardgame.name: Mircalla's Fantasy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A 2 page mini-RPG about European nobility's vampiresses. Contains elements of romance, BDSM, eroticism, otome, yuri, treason and violence.

boardgame.name: Gundalow
boardgame.description:
Get ready to set sail!

Set in the Seacoast region around Portsmouth, New Hampshire, you will travel the waterways as the captain of your own gundalow - a flat-bottomed sailboat historically used for transporting cargo. Each player starts the game in one of six towns around Great Bay. Each town will have its own unique market of available and wanted goods, drawn from a deck of market cards. Players use their money to purchase goods from the markets for delivery to other towns in order to make a profit. Players can also pick up passengers who are looking for transport to other towns.

After loading the goods and passengers onto their gundalow, players roll a die to sail to other towns around Great Bay and the Piscataqua River. The deepwater port of Portsmouth has exotic and highly-profitable goods available (such as spices and cotton) but it’s a long journey down the Piscataqua River.

Event cards come into play when players land on the event squares on the game board. Event cards offer new challenges and opportunities to players and will create dynamic and exciting market conditions. Players may need to adjust their trade routes to be successful! Resourcefulness and flexibility are the keys to successfully competing against the other gundalow captains.

The game ends when one player accumulates $100. Players then tally their goods and passengers delivered, and the players with the highest totals receive one or more of several honorary titles and victory cards. Will you earn the coveted “Richest Captain” honorary title (awarded to the player who accumulates the most money) or perhaps the gratifying “Friend to Farmers” honorary title (awarded to the player who delivers the most marsh hay). With a rich variety of goods, markets, and events, each game of Gundalow is unique, challenging, and rewarding. The game also comes with several suggested variants, which all combine to create a fun game with limitless variability.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Puerta Grande
boardgame.description:
Puerta Grande is a trivia game about the world of bullfighting where two, three or four players can play.

Questions cover the following categories:

Bullfighting Dictionary
Bullfighters and proxies
Bullfighting concepts
Livestock and Ranchers
History of Bullfighting
Bullring and Businessmen


A game for bullfighting fans of any age.

boardgame.name: Phineas and Ferb Action Game
boardgame.description:
A 2-in-1 card game based on the popular animated series.

Action Game:
A shedding game in which it's vital to plan ahead. Make good use of the special power cards, and be the first to play your last card (together with a quip from the show), and you're the winner!

Happy Families
Reunite separated characters by trying to steal them from your opponents in a Go Fish-style family card game. Collect the most sets to be victorious.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Thenn Warriors
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Guerriers Thenn
boardgame.description:
Most of the Free Folk’s forces arm and armor themselves with whatever they can craft along the way to battle or steal off of their fallen enemies. The Thenn Warriors are different. They have forged their own bronze weapons and armor, making them the most heavily-armed troops in the Free Folk army. While their equipment might not stand up to the castle-forged steel of the southern forces, it fares better than leather and fur shirts.

The Thenn Warriors unit box gives Free Folk commanders their arguably hardiest troops on the battlefield. Their increased armor has given them a sense of invulnerability, calling out Taunts to their enemies, causing charges to be targeted at them instead of other units. They also benefit from Set Defense, which means they ignore penalties from being charged, or attacked in the flank or rear. Coming with the unit is the Chosen of Styr Unit Attachment, whose Intimidating presence causes an enemy to become Weakened when they activate.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk Starter Set

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Wardens
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Gardiens Baratheon
boardgame.description:
House Baratheon’s battle doctrine is fairly simple: be strong like iron. They outfit their troops in heavy armor at every level and arm them with the House’s signature warhammer. While this heavy kit does slow down troop movements, the tenacity of their defenses can usually see them through. The Baratheon Wardens are the main infantry unit that the House uses, fielding many ranks of these rough and rugged fighters.

The Baratheon Wardens unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon commanders a tough, resilient set of troops for their forces. Clad in plate mail and carrying heavy shields, they have a good Defense Save stat, though all of that does slow them down. Their heavy warhammer attacks can crush the enemy’s spirit as much as it can crush their bones. Defending against these pounding attacks can leave enemy troops gasping for air as the strength is sucked from them.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Starter Set

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Sentinels
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Sentinelles Baratheon
boardgame.description:
For most armies, the armor worn by the Baratheon Sentinels would count them as heavy infantry. But for House Baratheon, they only are classified as medium infantry. Still, their resilient plate mail can turn away most attacks, while their warhammers make quick work of enemies out on the field.

The Baratheon Sentinels Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Baratheon commanders a new melee unit for their forces. Simple and straightforward, the Sentinels head into battle confident in the power of their armor. On the attacking side of the coin, the Sentinel’s double warhammers can crush enemies under the weight of their mighty blows, easily sundering enemy armor.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Starter Set

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Champions of the Stag
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Champions du Cerf
boardgame.description:
House Baratheon’s philosophy of “heavy arms and heavier armor” extends even to its cavalry. The Champions of the Stag are some of the heaviest armored in all of Westeros. These mounted knights head to battle in full plate, their huge destrier horses kitted with full barding. Yet, they still remain rather maneuverable during battle. These knights can be used as a flanking force, or simply plunged straight into the heart of an enemy formation.

The Champions of the Stag unit for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Baratheon commanders a heavy cavalry option for their forces. With strong Defensive Save and Morale stats and multiple wounds per figure, they can withstand enemy attacks very well. They are also formidable on offense, gaining special bonuses with their Champion’s Wrath ability, which grants Critical Blow and forces the enemy to become Weakened if they roll any 1s when making Defensive Saves against their attacks. Truly a strong unit to have on the battlefield.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Diceborn Heroes: Hero Card Pack Expansion
boardgame.description:
A limited print run pack expansion that wasn't included with the Kickstarter featuring 30 cards.

A new adventure begins with additional hero classes & quests for Diceborn Heroes. A new LVL 1 hero class, the Acrobattler, is now available with 3 other classes. Also new monster cards to shuffle into existing monster decks. Can you overcome the new challenges that await?

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

300 trade goods in three categories:

1 - Materials & technological stuff
2 - Warfare
3 - Organic, chemical, & stuff

boardgame.name: Monstrum Prodigium
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Parabola. Known throughout the universe as “the city of a thousand-thousand rusted veins,” this world of ancient metal pipes and a near-endless number of twisted towers is a strange pocket dimension that exists alongside the infinite number of other spheres in the universe. Parabola is a world of nothing but city streets, alleys, and sewers, a place where bizarre, terrifying creatures are commonplace and the heroic adventurers who journey from sphere to sphere are looked at as the outsiders.

The inhabitants of Parabola are considered enemies by many of the citizens of the cosmos. Where possible, the rulers of other places have done their best to block passage between their home world and the city of Parabola. Portals have at times been destroyed. Guards at cosmic ports of call have been instructed to turn away all visitors from Parabola. Some of the larger worlds of the universe have even gone so far as to use tons of earth to bury those portals that could not be destroyed.

Still, despite the best efforts of the other spheres of the cosmos, the citizens of the city of Parabola find their way through the many obstacles and visit the other lands as they wish. Some of them take a perverse joy in terrorizing the citizens of the other worlds, traveling across time and space for the chance to murder a random stranger. It is likely no surprise that most sentient beings in the universe consider the people of Parabola to be nothing more than wicked, vile monsters that must be stopped.

boardgame.name: Superfluous Spells!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sixty completely unnecessary spells. Honestly, you do not need any of these spells. In fact, there's a strong possibility that buying this collection of spells will only lead to you reading a handful of pages and, at most, using one or two of the spells in an actual game session.

Seriously, do not buy Superfluous Spells! because you do not need more spells. You have plenty of spells.

boardgame.name: 100 Millionaires 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list features a whole bunch of millionaires for your modern era campaign. Some folks have barely broke their first million while other entries are more suited for multi-millionaires who are steadily working towards breaking into the billionaire territory. Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, role/occupation, and a general descriptive.

Use these folks as associates to criminals, victims of criminals, annoying people the characters have to deal with, innocent bystanders, crooked influences, or anything else you may need for a modern/crime, superhero campaign, or otherwise.

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Airport Chatter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list features a bunch of different things that you might overhear in a noisy airport. Some stuff is purely trivial while others might be clues or potential links for a modern/crime, low powered super hero, or international spy setting.

boardgame.name: Ravenfeast
boardgame.description:
Ravenfeast includes a short, simple set of skirmish rules that play in 1-2 hours. But this free book is also a toolkit for new players, providing optional rules, army building guides, modeling tutorials, starter scenarios, and all of the extra resources you need to get started! We'll guide you step-by-step and welcome you into this fantastic hobby!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Test of Magic Power
boardgame.description:
Preparation
All(5) Magic stone cards (Hereafter "Ms") to common deck.

All(10) Level 1 and all(10) Level 2 Magic cards(Hereafter “Mg”) each to common deck.

“First Exam”
The “First Exam” will consist of five rounds

1. determination of the starting player (hereafter “SP”)
The player who rolls the die and rolls the lowest number becomes SP. After that, The player who draws a Ms card is the SP.

2. what you can do on your turn
2-1. SP's turn

(1) SP rolls three dice and draw an Mg card(*).

(2) Changing of Turn : The players take turns in a clockwise direction. During the turn change, any one die may be rolled once to interfere with the next player.
In addition, if you have 1 or more Mg cards in your hand, you may stock (set aside) 1 Mg card in your hand. The stocked Mg cards cannot be used during that round, but are added to your hand at the start of the next round. Only one Mg card may be stocked at the end of your turn, and you may stock up to two (no Ms cards can be stocked).

2-2. non-SP turns

(1) Dice Action (see "3. Choosing a Dice Action")

(2) Use of Mg cards (see "4. Use of Mg cards")

Turn change: Same as in the case of SP's turn.

3. Choosing a die action
Choose one of the following three actions

A. Roll two dice. Draw an card corresponding to the result (*). After that, you may use the Mg cards in your hand. However, you cannot draw an Mg card after you have used the Mg card. (You can still draw Ms cards(*).

B. Roll a die. After that, you may use any Mg cards in your hand. However, you cannot draw an Mg card until the next turn (but you can draw Ms cards(*)).

C. Do not roll a die. After that, you may draw an card (*). However, you may not use an Mg card until your next turn.


: When drawing a card, the roll of the die must meet the following conditions, depending on the type of card (see the lower left corner of the card).


Ms Card→Every die roll must be the same (identical)

Level 1 Mg cards -> two dice with the same roll (e.g. “1, 1, 4” , “3, 3, 6” etc.)

Level 2 Mg cards → 3 consecutive die rolls (e.g. “1, 2, 3”, “3, 4, 5” etc.)

4. Use of Mg cards
Mg cards can also be used before a die action(even if you choose die action C, you can still use Mg cards before the die action).
And that time, you can draw Ms card if you can make every die roll to the same.

5. End of the round
When any player draws a Ms card, the round ends. When the round is over, all players return their Mg cards to each deck and shuffle them. At the start of the next round, each player adds his or her stock of Mg cards to his or her hand. If the number of cards in the hand is 4 (3 in 2 players) or more, the player discards the Mg cards so that the number of cards in his hand is 3(2 in 2 players).

When all Ms cards have been drawn (after five rounds), the “Final Exam” begins.

6. “Final Exam”
No Mg cards will be used in the “Final Exam”. If a player fails to take any Ms cards at the “First Exam”, he or she will be disqualified at this point.

(1) All players who take the “Final Exam” must reveal the Ms cards in their hands. If the player with the lowest total points has 1 point Ms card(Ms has 1 to 3 points), he or she becomes the “Summoner”, and an errand boy is summoned.

The Ms card of the player with the highest Ms card total is shuffled by adding 1 point Ms card to the Ms card of the player with the highest Ms card total points. The “Summoner” draws one card from the cards and makes it his or her own hand.

(2) Magic value calculation
Each player multiply the total points of Ms cards in their hand with the numbers of players. And that is each player's magic value.

Start the “Magic value amplification” with the player who has the highest magic value starts.

(3) Magic value amplification
The player who rolls three dice and multiplies the total points of the dice by the magic value to determine the “Final magic value”. The player with a “Final magic value” of 80 points or more passes the exam.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 暗夜之光 (Light in the Dark)
boardgame.description:
暗夜之光 ("Light in the Dark") is a tactical board game that supports 2 to 4 players. The story is set in a parallel world of medieval Europe. In this world where swords and magic exist at the same time, one player plays the role of a dark legion headed by vampires to control the powerful dark night creatures invading the human world, and the other player plays the human guard and leads the heroic royal knights to defend the kingdom of Italia Border town.

Players form a legion according to certain rules (both sides have the same number of troop recruitment points to form a legion with equal total strength), deploy troops on the map, and command them to fight. The types of troops in the game are very rich. Players need to make various adjustments according to the characteristics of the troops and combined with the terrain, and reasonably issue various instructions such as attack, active defense, retreat and rest. At the same time, each player constructs his own battle deck, and players can use these battle cards to greatly influence the battle.

【Victory conditions】

1. If the Dark Legion destroys the human town within 12 rounds, the Dark Legion wins, otherwise the Human Guard wins.
2. At any time, repel all opponent forces, then our camp wins. (In "Light in the Dark", victory is calculated by camp. As long as a camp meets the above conditions for victory, all players in that camp are deemed to have won the victory together.)

—description from the publisher (translated)

《暗夜之光》是一款支持2〜4人的版图战术游戏，故事背景设定在平行世界的中世纪欧洲。在这个剑与魔法同时存在的世界中，一方玩家扮演以吸血鬼为首的黑暗军团，统御强大的暗夜生物入侵人类世界，另一方玩家扮演人类卫队，率领英勇的王家骑士团保卫伊塔利亚王国的边境小镇。

玩家根据一定规则组建军团（双方拥有相同的部队招募点数，组成总实力相等的军团），在地图上部署部队，并指挥他们进行战斗。游戏中的部队种类非常丰富，玩家需要根据部队的特点，结合地形进行各种调动，并合理下达攻击、主动防御、后撤休整等各种指令。与此同时，每位玩家分别构筑自己的战斗套牌，游戏中玩家可以使用这些战斗卡牌极大影响战局。

【胜利条件】

1.黑暗军团在12回合内摧毁人类小镇，则黑暗军团获胜，否则人类卫队获胜。
2.任意时刻，击退所有对手部队，则我方阵营获胜。（在《暗夜之光》，胜利以阵营来计算。只要某阵营达成上述胜利条件，则该阵营的所有玩家视为一起赢得了胜利。）

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Gate Ruler
boardgame.description:
Gate Ruler is a Japanese trading card game designed by the designer of Future Card Buddyfight.
Each player in this game plays a ruler, and each ruler has his/her own rules, so that each player can fight in the same game with different rules. Like most tcgs, each player use creatures to fight with the opponent, and the player makes the opponent's life to 0 will win the game.

boardgame.name: Hockey Mania
boardgame.description:
The object of the game is for the player to obtain a numerical advantage over the opponent while preventing the opponent from scoring goals. When this happens, the player is entitled to a card which authorizes him to move one of his forwards in a given direction and specific number of spaces. A forward may only score a goal from a certain specific spaces. Each period ends when the ten "penalty" cards have been used.

The forwards move according to a tricolor dice which plays a double role based on both numerical and value and its color. Thus, the die allows a man to advance the number of spaces corresponding tot he number thrown or, depending on its color, to send a man into the game (WHITE), win a face-off (RED) or scorer a goal (BLUE). The defensemen move one space at a time, in the dircestion determined by the players.

boardgame.name: Bushrangers
boardgame.description:
Bushrangers is a game named after the Australian term for Highwaymen or Outlaws. They were mostly sons of Australian born convicts and became legendary during the Australian Gold Rush of the 1850s and 1860s, robbing banks and coach services. Many became folk heros, such as Ned Kelly rebelling against authority and remain popular in Australian culture

The game has at least one player taking the Mail coach playing piece, starting at either end of the Mail coach road. Other players are Bushrangers beginning at the other end of the board at the Bushrangers lair.

The Mail coach follows the road by rolling a dice and it's objective is to get to the other end. The Bushrangers follow the black spots by rolling the dice and try to intercept the Mail coach. If they land on the Mail coach they have held up the coach and won the come. If he overshoots the Mail coach he cannot go backwards and must follow the track to meet the coach again.

The game can have two Mail coaches in play and several Bushrangers. The coaches can also carry counters representing money.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Bananopolis: The Monkey Sanctuary
boardgame.description:
Learn about conservation and the reintroduction of endangered species back into their natural habitats in this fun and simple to play board game for 2-4 players.

The aim is simple, to release all of your monkeys back into the wild first. To achieve this, you will need to help them find food, work together, and out-compete their rivals.

Use dice to determine what options you have to place your fruit, and your monkey's movement, then position your monkeys to make sure you can pick it up first. As your monkeys are released you have fewer options making it harder to stay on ahead of your rivals.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #10)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue #10 of The Glatisant! This newsletter is a free service put out by the Questing Beast YouTube channel.

New and Upcoming Products
Reviews
Theory
Tabletop vs Video Games
Diceless Gaming
Game Design
History
101 Cursed Items

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Mon quartier
boardgame.description:
Buy land, build and improve your neighborhood ... and collect your rent!
Players buy land to build houses, hotels, and grow their neighborhood.
They draw Money cards, collect rent, but watch out for the effects of Action cards!
Once the 6 in-game hotels have been built, the game ends. Who will have built the most profitable district?

boardgame.name: Journey to the Inside Out
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:
Beneath our feet is the mythological hollow world – a realm of dense jungles, putrid swamps and rugged mountains. Here a brave party will struggle for survival as they seek to fathom the unseen expanse and to prevent a once defeated god to rise again.

‘Journey to the Inside Out’ can be played as a stand-alone scenario or be used as the first installment in a trilogy of connected adventure modules each taking place in a different era.

The scenario can be used with Swords & Wizardry or any other early variant of game rules and is suitable for PCs level 2-4. Inside you will find:

A 40+ page old-school module with a layout optimized for fast and easy interfacing.
A challenging lost world setting with the possibility to toggle the complexity.
Alternative suggestions for entry to the hollow inside.
Downloadable maps for both players and the Referee.
Story-points for a guided scenario and tables for sandbox and hexcrawl-style play.
Advice for an ongoing campaign.
Locations allowing the PCs to travel to another era within the setting.
Unique new creatures.

boardgame.name: Race Royale
boardgame.description:
Race Royale is a fast-paced racing, party game where teams of two compete to out-race, out-wit or blast their opponents off the track! Last car on the track is the winner!

Inspired by retro top-down racing video games, this board game adaptation lets teams of two take the wheel of a fast and furious, bustling bluffing bonanza. Because the theme of the race is "top-down" the drivers can't really see where they're going and must trust in the collective movement of the pack. Just follow the leader, but does the leader know they way or is he/she just trying to trick you into driving off the road?

Out-smart your opponents, or collect power-ups, weapons to use against them. It pays to be in the lead, but as soon as you stop trusting in whoever is in front of you, you must slow down to have time to react, and before you know it, you'll fall behind!

This bluff filled party game plays well with an even number of players, from 4 to 10. You can help your team mate by passing them information when they need it the most, or prevent them from crashing at a crucial moment by clever card play. As the race goes by, the road becomes more predictable and players may be tempted to take their chances in order to gain the much desired lead. Since the track is randomly generated, the finish line could come suddenly. In order for you (and your team mate) to win, you must be the first to cross the finish line, or have the last car on the track!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ugly Gryphon Inn: More Patrons
boardgame.description:
You’ve finally cleared out the bar and sent everyone off to bed...but what’s that sound? A knock at the door, at this hour? Why, it’s just what you need: MORE patrons jostling for a spot at your inn! It’s gonna be a long night...

These patrons are particularly picky, and will make your night even more difficult!

These expansion cards are shuffled into the starting deck, adding to the available Patrons found in the base game. You’ll need to manage these new needy customers more carefully, as your inn will require one more contented patron to be considered successful.

boardgame.name: Dark Venture: Battle of the Ancients – Kings and Heroes
boardgame.description:
The KINGS and HEROES expansion adds the KINGSGUARD faction and additional HEROES to the DARK VENTURE: BATTLE of the ANCIENTS Core game.

The KINGSGUARD utilize their own deck of ITEM CARDS, an armory of weapons, that are equipped to their soldiers. Their BLOODSMEN units are very strong and have an ability that allows them to modify their attack rolls. Their HUNTSMEN units can be equipped with bows that provide them with ranged attacks.

Each included HERO is their own single-unit-faction. A hero-controlling player has a 'hero dashboard card' to track the progress of their hero and a single unit on the map. Each hero has powerful special skills that are unlocked as HERO POINTS are earned, when specific objectives are met.

This expansion also includes AUTO ENEMY decks for the Kingsguard faction and for Heroes; the FOREGONE KING’S CASTLE map; a SCENARIO book that includes an ADVENTURE SCENARIO (a branching, replayable, open-world story); additional ITEM and ACTION cards to add to the game, and much more.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dark Venture: Battle of the Ancients

boardgame.name: The Smoky Valley
boardgame.description:
The Smoky Valley is a heavy economic and industrial development game set around the Lachine Canal, which is located in the Griffintown neighborhood in Montréal, Canada.

In The Smoky Valley, you are an investor during the 19th century, contributing to the standing of Griffintown as a key industrial area in North America by building and upgrading industries, producing and transforming goods, & shipping goods abroad.

Besides these activities for the good of Griffintown and your own wealth, you will also have to stimulate the development of the city to boost economic activities, provide public services, and increase the quality of life of citizens. If your actions are well received by the citizens and your popularity raises faster than your opponents, you may even become mayor of the city. This office will offer you the chance to influence the city's development for the best of your interests - as well as your citizens', of course!

Do you have what it takes to be remembered as the greatest builder of The Smoky Valley?

boardgame.name: Dark Venture: Battle of the Ancients – Beasts and Eggmen
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds the BEAST and EGGMEN factions to the DARK VENTURE: BATTLE of the ANCIENTS Core game, along with a traveling MERCHANT character.

Many of the creatures found in the BEAST faction have STRENGTH or DEFENSE values that fluctuate with each combat encounter, they are unpredictable and often very powerful. However they are limited in number: Beast faction players can have only 4 units on the map at a time. Beast units are brought onto the map after being randomly drawn from the BEAST BAG.

The EGGMAN faction soldiers are ‘psychically linked’ to one another and are able to move together in ‘formations’ to travel across the map in groups. An EGGMAN WIZARD can be created to cast impressive spells, providing ranged attacks and upgrades to other Eggman units.

The MERCHANT provides magical items, skills and powerful mercenary units to players. Darvin the merchant accepts VICTORY POINTS and TRADED ITEMS as payment for his wares.

This expansion also includes AUTO ENEMY decks for the Beast and Eggman factions; the EGG KING’S CASTLE map-boards (First Floor, Second Floor and Turrets); a SCENARIO book that includes an ADVENTURE SCENARIO (a branching, replayable, open-world story); additional ITEM and ACTION cards to add to the game, and much more.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dark Venture: Battle of the Ancients

boardgame.name: Grand Austria Hotel: Christmas Time Promo
boardgame.description:
Ho-ho-ho! Santa Claus is coming to the Grand Austria Hotel!

When completing a green guest's order, you can now choose to move them into a Christmas room (instead of a normal blue, red, or yellow room). If you do so, you get the bonus points printed on the Christmas room tile as well as the victory points from the guest card - and you also get to select a Present token which can provide you with additional staff cards, steps on the Emperor track, food resources, krones, or victory points.

Print and Play: https://lookout-spiele.de/upload/en_grandaustriahotel.html_G...

boardgame.name: Chaos über Denver
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Collects three Shadowrun missions:


Denver Adventure 1: Serrated Edge
Denver Adventure 2: False Flag
Denver Adventure 3: Ripping Reality


Publisher's blurb:

Das Chaos erhebt sich

Denver, die Stadt der Spione. Die Stadt des Großen Drachen Ghostwalker. Ein wichtiger Dreh- und Angelpunkt der Sechsten Welt. In diesem Moloch aus Intrigen und politischen Ränken zieht es die Runner in ein Netz aus Machtkämpfen, dunklen Geheimnissen und Schattenspielen. Es beginnt in den Slums der Aurora Warrens, in denen die Runner tief im Dreck ominöser Machenschaften wühlen und damit das Fundament der Stadt erschüttern. Und die Wellen dieser Erschütterung ziehen sich langsam aber sicher bis zu den Mächtigsten der Stadt. Denver verwandelt sich in einen Kampfplatz von Kräften, die lieber nicht entfesselt werden sollten. Und während die Runner sich mit befleckter Magie, altem Neid und tödlichen Kreaturen auseinandersetzen müssen, droht der ganze Plex zu fallen.

Chaos über Denver bietet eine komplette und abgeschlossene Kampagne mit mehreren Abenteuern für Shadowrun 5. Alle Abenteuer sind komplett spielfertig und bieten spannenden Spielspaß in einer dramatischen Story, gespickt mit Höhepunkten und Action. In den verschiedenen Teilen müssen die Shadowrunner all ihr Können und ihre Erfahrung einsetzen, um ihren Job zu erledigen und dabei vielleicht die Stadt vor dem Untergang zu bewahren. Oder selbst unterzugehen.

boardgame.name: Getting In
boardgame.description:
Every year, hundreds of thousands of high school students apply for college, competing for spaces in colleges and universities all over the world. Applying for college is a process and can be overwhelming. This exciting card game introduces players to the various components of the admissions application process. The goal is to simulate the process in a general way by providing insight on the various parts of a college application file.

After all players receive two schools to "apply" to, players take turns, drawing cards, and adding various requirements cards to their school's portfolios. There are also action cards you can play on other player's applications to "lose" specific documents or otherwise cause them extra work in their application.

The winner is the first person to complete successful applications to two schools.

This game is endorsed by the Michigan College Access Network (MCAN).

boardgame.name: Sugar Ponies and the Quest for the Cotton Corns
boardgame.description:
Are you ready for a jaunt around the Rainblove Funtasy Furry Forest? Well, golly gee, you better be! The most fun you can have going in a circle and collecting things is just a hop, skip, and a half-gallop away!

In this ridiculous follow-up to the Sugar Ponies card game, you’ll compete against your pals in a race to the finish to acquire “Lil’ Happies” (aka Cottoncorns)! But remember: It’s not about who wins; it’s about the buddies you make along the way! And we all know you can’t spell “win” without “friends”!

boardgame.name: Agamemnon (Issue 5 - Sep 1986)
boardgame.description: Issue 5 attempted to reach a broader readership by being given away for free.

boardgame.name: Nomads Core Book
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

NOMADS is a modern fantasy RPG set in infinite worlds. In it, players take on the role of Nomads, beings who have the ability to cross the cracks in the veil that separates the universes. NOMADS is different from most RPGs in that it does not need a game master or narrator, dividing the responsibility for the story among the players. Also, the game needs no preparation: you can start playing in minutes, with a new group and new characters. With a robust narrative creation system, NOMADS allows players to start an epic story quickly. With a structure based on TV series, NOMADS has tables to create a consistent plot, with objectives, relationships between the characters, antagonists, plot complications, sinister creatures and much more. No group? No problem! NOMADS also allows the SOLO game, in which a player controls one or more characters.

UNLIMITED REALITIES

NOMADS is set in infinite universes. The characters have the ability to transit through them through portals called mirrors. Players can use this power both to reevaluate the truths of the story as it unfolds, and in combat, to see if the conditions in the new universe are the same as in the previous one. It is perfectly possible - for example - for players to pass through a mirror and arrive in a parallel universe where enemies are at a profound disadvantage! In addition to the mirrors there are the Medusae, portals of great magnitude that take the characters to other macroverses - new sets of infinite parallel universes. These macroverses can be represented in a number of ways. Do players want a medieval fantasy adventure? No problems. Do you want a futuristic, or post-apocalyptic story? It is also possible. Unreality contemplates everyone.

THE SYSTEM

NOMADS uses its own system, with poker cards. Character creation takes into account characteristics rather than numbers. A character can be, for example, an “intelligent policeman who knows how to shoot”. From there, it is up to the players to use logic and interpretation to assess the chances that he would have to perform different actions. Would a policeman have any advantage in interrogating a witness? Certainly. And to hack a computer system? Probably not.

In addition to the basic characteristics, the characters can also acquire Talents, they interact with the story, giving them advantages, such as great strength, agility or the ability to better know creatures from other realities.

NOMADS counts on a brutal and merciless combat system, in which tactics are of great value, bringing various weapons, armor and equipment.

THE BOOK

NOMADS is a book in A5 format, fully colored and with 244 pages. The work is divided into five chapters: the first presents some of the main characters in the universe, such as Ducann and Suri, members of an organization that protects the nomads from the Void, a universal force that sees them as anomalies and tries to eliminate them. In Ducann's Diary, players will have information about the infinite universes, mirrors and medusae, the mysterious Cult of Glass and more.

In the second chapter the rules of the game are explained, with many examples, tables and rules for combat and equipment. In the third chapter, the players - already familiar with the basic rules - will be able to play an introductory campaign as the Girl and Crow, two important characters in the NOMADS universes. In the adventure they must chase an Incognito, a nomad dominated by the Void.

The fourth chapter presents the rules for creating characters and stories, so that players can dive deeper into the universe of Unreality. Here, they will find mechanics for creating complex plots, with different objectives for their characters, twists, hooks and various elements of adventure and tension present in the best TV series. Finally, the fifth chapter brings ideas of adventures, profiles of characters and creatures, in addition to more than 30 tables for fast generation of scenes, monsters, characters, equipment and several other useful elements for your stories.

boardgame.name: TOZAN
boardgame.description:
TOZAN is a solitaire game from Japan for a mountain climber. The game is very quick to play, only five minutes, and the player must ascend and descend the 8000m mountain safely. But the mountain is capricious, and the weather changes rapidly. So the climber must be prepared, plan ahead, maintain their strength, and watch for a lucky break.

The deck is 16 cards only but has variety, so the player will be able to play the game over again and again.

Some of the cards are used to plot the climber's ascent, and health. The other cards determine the weather (Kaze (Wind), Hare (Sun), and climbing conditions (Iwa (Rocky)).
user summary

boardgame.name: Armor Earned
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many great warriors seek armor that allows them to wade through battles, inspire awe in those who see it, and become a personal badge of honor. The armors detailed directly are legendary, but not because they were created on some non-descript anvil. These armors are legendary because their abilities were earned. Any sufficiently-skilled wizard and dwarven craftsman can join forces to create beautiful armor, nay, even powerful magicked armor. But only circumstances can create these armors. Want Blood-Bathed armor? Be prepared to quest for it- as it can’t even be created in a single generation. Has your armor been touched by a God? Swallowed by a Kraken? Or has it taken you unharmed through the Gates of Hell? Then this guide will describe the benefits for fifteen armors that have been earned not simply forged.

This work, in order to be of use to all fantasy RPGers, contains tips for designing mechanics but incomplete actual game mechanics. This is the legendary story and the circumstance for each, numbers are suggested at times, but not every fantasy game system features the same mechanics (damage reduction, ablative armor, stamina ratings, saves, etc.). You're buying the fluff not the crunch (though some crunch is suggested)

boardgame.name: The Huntsman's Feast
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The award-winning Trophy Dark incursion!
Balen Doen has eluded justice for too long and the Guards have had it, posting a bounty large enough to motivate anyone with even an ounce of greed. You and your… friends have become bounty hunters, pursuing Doen out of the city. As his path has come closer and closer to The Forest, the less-bold bounty hunters have turned for home. But you aren’t turning back. Doen has hidden himself in the supposedly-abandoned hunting manor of the Marquess Niral. It sits on the border of The Forest, but surely it can’t contain any unforeseen horrors. Can it? The Huntsman’s Feast is a one-shot adventure of dark fantasy for 2-4 players and 1 game master for an about 3 hour session.

Content Warning.
This incursion contains potentially triggering content related to hunting, taxidermy, and animal mutilation.

boardgame.name: Inner Core Themes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the Shining Center of the Galaxy!

Four new themes perfect for heroes that hail from the shining systems and populous planets at the heart of interstellar civilization. You always had access to education and the physical, social, and intellectual resources that advanced technology had to offer, even if you lived on the margins as you trained for your adventuring career. Master music of the spheres as an adept of the song, become a star of the holo-news service as a correspondent, uncover the truth as a mystic detective, and learn the secrets of the ancients as a prehistorian. Any one of them is perfect for the discerning and cultured character!

boardgame.name: Rochemont Quarry
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

boardgame.name: The Tower Under Mudstick Hill
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone knows the old ruins on the top of Mudstick Hill. But no one knows that the 'ruins' aren't the ground floor of an old tower - but are actually the top floor of a buried tower! What's down there?

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map with a 30x30 (surface) and five 20x20 levels
Surface Level - a circular ruin atop a hill
Level -1: Necromancer study
Level -2: Necromancer lab
Level -3: Abadoned hallways
Level -4: Abandoned prison
Level -5: Infernal prison

A set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A multiple level map consisting of a seven level Alien megastructure
Level 0 - snow-covered alien pyramid
Level 1 - ice cold organic chamber
Level 2 - alien tunnels
Level 3 - Dormant machine
Level 4 - Portal
Level 5 - Cryo Chambers
Level 6 - Birthing Pool

boardgame.name: Eyno Bleside Housing District
boardgame.description:

A wretched hive of scum and villainy!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30 x 30 maps depicting the interior and exterior of a sci-fi housing district on a desert planet. Would work well for Tatooine.

boardgame.name: どんてんのきりあい (Donten no Kiriai)
曇天／斬合 (Donten no Kiriai)
曇天／斬合 Legend (Donten no Kiriai Legend)
boardgame.description:
曇天／斬合 Legend (Donten no Kiriai Legend) is a Japanese card game for one or two players. It was originally published as 曇天／斬合 (Donten no Kiriai) in 2017. The designer then spun off a simpler game, 曇天／斬合 Tactics (Donten no Kiriai Tactics) to make it easier to learn the game, and republished this edition as 曇天／斬合 Legends for intermediate and experienced players. It is available free as a Print 'n' Play game to download.

Two Samurais duel, using basic movement cards and two special attacks each round. The duel continues, round after round, until one of the Samurai succumbs to their wounds.

The players take a basic deck of six cards, and two special cards from a set of five. Players set up the duelling positions, with the Samurai initially being two steps apart, and then each secretly chooses a hand card face-down. When they are ready, the cards are turned up.

The basic cards involve the Samurai advancing or retreating, and adopting different stances. If the Samurai move close enough together, and onto the same spot, then a strike might happen. But the Samurai switch between being in a Standing stance, and a Ready stance. So an attack can only be made when the Samurai is Ready, otherwise the player falls back to Standing.

Basic attacks can be made repeatedly, the card goes back to the player's hand when used. But the Special card attacks are used only once a round, and then discarded.

A round ends when a successful strike is made, and damage is shown on the attacking card. The player struck loses hit points. The decks are re-sorted and the players gain two Special cards again.

The first player to lose all their health loses the duel.
user summary

boardgame.name: Fabulas de Peluche. ¡Oh, hermanito!
Fiabe di Stoffa: Oh, Fratellino!
Der Herr der Träume: Bruderherz
Histoires de Peluches: Petit Frère
Stuffed Fables: Oh, Brother!
boardgame.description:
The brave stuffies from Stuffed Fables return for another round of bedtime adventures! Years after the original story, a new baby brother joins the family, bringing two toy companions of his own: Pokey the unicorn, a stalwart stuffy, and the muscular Manny, a headstrong hand-me-down action figure. With a sweet little boy to protect from the forces of the Fall, Pokey and Manny must learn the ropes from the beloved original cast and face a slate of new monsters from under the bed!

The Stuffed Fables: Oh, Brother! expansion includes a new storybook, with new challenges, enemies, and fables, along with new tokens, sleep cards, and its own discovery deck to lead you through each unique adventure, but you will need components from the Stuffed Fables base game in order to play.

In addition to everything else, Pokey the Unicorn and Manny the Action Figure join the cast, adding their unique abilities to the team. Pokey doesn't equip any weapon items, but instead uses her Puffy Horn to fend off enemies. Manny, as a macho action figure, is made of strong plastic instead of the usual stuffing of other characters, so certain status conditions don't affect him as they would a typical stuffy.

Can you protect your little boy from the dangers of the supernatural fall?

2021 UK Games Expo Best Variant or Expansion People's Choice Winner
